DataElement.preferredName: Photon Beam Radiation Therapy  Administration Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the number of times photon beam radiation therapy was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the administration of photon beam radiation therapy

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A single unit of electromagnetic radiation, generally considered to be a discrete particle having no mass or charge.:A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: A single unit of electromagnetic radiation, generally considered to be a discrete particle having no mass or charge.
A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/11/17 tt transferred context, added reg status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If yes, provide # of photon t
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, provide # of photon treatments

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Provide the number of photon fractions the patient was administered

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Provide the number of photon fractions the patient received
